results.title: Epilepsy in childhood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Parents and children discuss the circumstances and behaviour that led to their child being diagnosed with epilepsy, ranging from seizures to staring into space. They explain their very personal initial reaction to the news, deciding whether to medicate or not, the importance of a good relationship with medical staff, the impact on family and friends, schooling, lifestyle changes, and how their children have changed with age and on receiving medication.

results.title: Living with breast cancer
results.creator_credit: Gillian Fawcett, Giovanna Pignaiosa, Anti Cancer Council, Cancer Council Victoria and Speaking From Experience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Breast cancer is a malignant tumor in the breast. The severity of the disease depends on the size of the cancer and whether it has spread to other parts of the body. This excellent and informative documentary presents five women of varying age, who have all experienced the trauma of breast cancer. Each woman relates her own personal story from the initial diagnosis and having to deal with the reality, to surgery and treatment and finally to recovery and the future. Various types of surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy are discussed including the side effects, physical and emotional, and the important role self-image can play in the road to recovery. Also stresses that the key to recovery is through support from family and friends in terms of encouragement, offers of help in daily routines, and generally in just being there. A common factor with each of the women is the way their outlook on life has changed, valuing each day as precious and maintaining a positive attitude as a means to coping with the disease. A warm and enlightening progam.

group_siblings.title: Alzheimer's disease and other dementias: Diagnosis = Speaking from experience
Grief, trauma and sexual abuse: the stories of two women

results.title: Grief, trauma and sexual abuse: the stories of two women
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Aimed at increasing awareness and consciousness of the crimes depicted, this episode from the “Speaking from experience” series looks at the experiences of Lucy and Tina. Lucy was sexually abused by her father as a young child; a situation that the remainder of her family was aware of. Tina was raped by an unknown assailant in her own home, a country property out of Melbourne. Both women speak candidly and honestly to varying degrees of detail about what happened to them, how they coped immediately afterwards and now, the impact it had on the rest of their family as well as intimate relationships, the benefits of talk therapy, the need for justice, and what has to be achieved to assist the healing process.

results.title: Alzheimer's disease and other dementias: Diagnosis = Speaking from experience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
This Australian program presents a sensitive account of Alzheimer’s disease from the point of view of their families and carers. It looks at the early signs and behaviours, and the ways in which the patients and their carers handle diagnosis of the condition. The emotional impact this disease has on families is openly discussed, as well as practical advice given on how carers can best handle the progression of the condition.

results.title: Alpine vistas: Mt. Hotham
results.creator_credit: Charles R. Herschell and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: A study of Mount Hotham, one of Victoria’s most popular winter-sport resorts. This film gives a glimpse of life in Victoria during the 1930’s.

results.title: Alone at home
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallen and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Clearly outlines procedures that children should be aware of when circumstances necessitate their remaining at home on their own. Highlights the need to keep a list of important phone numbers handy and when to use them; the need to be wary of letting strangers into the house or letting them know parents are out; how to work locks, thermostats etc… Suitable for years prep-6.

results.title: Almost everything you ever wanted to know about motivating people or Maslow's hierarchy of needs
results.brief_description: Instructional film which uses psychologist Abraham Maslow’s “Hierarchy of needs” model to explore how to increase worker productivity. The model posits five levels of need - physiological, security, social, esteem and finally, and most importantly, self-actualisation. Film uses short, fictional, badly acted scenarios to illustrate how each need can be satisfied in the workplace, and how damaging it is if each need is not satisfied. The point is made explicit that we don’t satisfy worker needs for their benefit, because it is humane and civilised, but because a happy worker will be more efficient and productive, thus more profitable.

results.title: All in a lifetime
results.creator_credit: Joe Mendoza, Derek Armstrong, John Shearman and Esso Petrol
results.brief_description: The film marks the 75th. Anniversary of the Esso Petroleum Company and surveys the progress of the oil industry from 1888 to the present day. Within a lifetime, the oil industry has revolutionised our habits and daily life. Historical black and white film shows the first methods of exploration and drilling, then the film pursues oil’s more modern ramifications ranging from the development of the jet engine to the latest oilfields; from laboratory research to motorways; from oil-fired industries to the new world of petrochemicals.

results.title: All America roses
results.brief_description: Shows how rose growers throughout the United States compete for the label “All-America-Rose” selection. Shows the checking of blooms at test stations where the best roses are brought to perfection; close-up studies of different varieties of roses; the use of roses in landscape gardening and interior decoration. Narrated by Peter Allen.

results.title: Alice in blunderland
results.creator_credit: W M. Moloney and Road Safety Council of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Road safety film made in Sydney using a parallel with the Alice in Wonderland fairytale to discuss issues of pedestrian and driver safety. Focusses on Alice who is more intent on her shopping than on paying attention to the traffic. She meets up with her boyfriend, “The Mad Hatter” and they go for a drive in the country and demonstrate the dangers of admiring the scenery instead of the road. Gives statistics comparing road deaths in NSW with WWII casualties. Features flashback footage of Sydney in 1908.
